divs: Sighting DetailsWhile Camping at the Carnagie SVRA: 18600 Corral Hollow Rd Tracy Ca 95377 At approximately 0435 hrs I was looking at the Constellation Aquila.I was startled by a bright single flash (magnitude 1 ) to west of ��� ( Zeta) Aquila (Approx. RA: 19h 4m 50s Dec: +13���46'33"). Then a single object traveling west to east following a straight path was observed having originated from the flash-point. The object faded out entering the constellation of Sagittarius. My conclusion, Most likely a satellite that occluded a star causing a "flash" fading out as it entered the constellation of Sagittarius.
